intro: Forsteronia floribunda, commonly known as the velvetleaf or velvetleaf hibiscus, is a tropical shrub native to Central and South America. It features large, heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture and a deep green color. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of yellow, orange, and red, typically blooming from summer to fall. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine. Forsteronia floribunda thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
